intro: Bactyrilobium ferrugineum, commonly known as the rusty lichen, is a member of the family Parmeliaceae. It is a foliose lichen characterized by its yellowish to orange-brown thallus with a distinctive, granular texture. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a green alga and a fungus, which allows it to thrive in various environmental conditions. It is typically found on bark, rocks, and soil in temperate regions. Its chemical composition includes pigments that contribute to its characteristic rusty coloration.
